title: Aurora
summary: An aurora[lower-alpha 1] (plural: auroras or aurorae[lower-alpha 2]), also known as the polar lights or aurora polaris,[lower-alpha 3] is a natural light display in Earth's sky, predominantly seen in high-latitude regions (around the Arctic and Antarctic). Auroras display dynamic patterns of brilliant lights that appear as curtains, rays, spirals or dynamic flickers covering the entire sky.[2]
